scheduler.generate
Class WeekAvail

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.Vector<U>
              scheduler.generate.GenWeekAvail<java.lang.Void,DayAvail>
                  scheduler.generate.WeekAvail
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<DayAvail>, java.util.Collection<DayAvail>, java.util.List<DayAvail>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class WeekAvail
extends GenWeekAvail<java.lang.Void,DayAvail>

Represents a Week's availability. For constant-definitions of the days in a week, look in generate.Week.java. This class is used for general availability: you can't have any two things overlapping. Ever. Thus, the type of things booked is "Void", which will always map to the 0th bit of the BitSet used to determine availability. The methods here have signature which omit this "Void" parameter, though it is part of the "GenAvail" object. To make up for this (since every booking will be the same Void type), the Void parameter is added here.

Author:
Eric Liebowitz

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

WeekAvail

public WeekAvail()
Creates a 7-entry array of availability for the day (one entry for every day in the week). The week starts out as completely available.
